results.title: Group farming
results.creator_credit: Australian Rural Adjustment Unit and Don Simmons
results.brief_description: Considers the advantages and disadvantages of group farming. Discusses the issues involved in the sharing or pooling by farmers of resources such as machinery and sheds.

results.title: Group discussions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Illustrates differences between social conversation and purposeful group discussion by showing how typical American family proceeds through various stages of a discussion on whether or not son should go to college. Family members shown in other group discussion situations in school, PTA, business conferences, and at symposium. Lists five factors in group discussion. Leadership and individual participation is stressed.

results.title: Group Activities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A group of children is presented with some common household materials with which to create things, as the basis for an art lesson. The teacher’s intent is to stimulate individual thought and effort without attempting to pre-determine their efforts.

results.title: Groundwork for progress
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Stewart McAllister and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: Today Britain is bringing her century-old railway system up to date. The modernisation plan includes relaying lines, strengthening bridges, and viaducts, and building new stations, good sheds, sidings, and marshalling yards. Shows the engineering problems are tackled and the work carried out without dislocation traffic on the most heavily used railway system in the world.

results.title: Groundwater
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: Explains the origins of groundwater and the relation of groundwater to the water cycle. Emphasizes the need for conservation and protection of the water supply from chemical and nuclear waste.

results.title: Groundhog Day
results.creator_credit: Trevor Albert, Columbia Pictures and Harold Ramis
results.brief_description: Have you ever had one of those days where you wished you could relive the day and do things differently? Wise cracking weatherman Phil, (Bill Murray) is living the same day over and over. It all begins when he is sent with other crew members to Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania to cover the annual Groundhog Day Festival; the one day of the year when the seasons weather forecast is decided by an animal. Initially they are to move out after the report but a snow storm leaves them snowbound. With no tomorrow and no consequences to face, Phil is eager to explore every fantasy and possibility, and he does. Trying to enamour himself to the producer Rita, (Andie MacDowall) proves harder than he thought, no matter how long he has to try. Also starring Chris Elliot, Brian Doyle-Murray and Stephen Tobolowsky.

results.title: Ground Zero
results.brief_description: Harvey Denton (Colin Friels) is movie cameraman who is plunged into a bewildering series of events when, one night, his flat is viciously ransacked. Someone is after something, but what? Now Trebilcock of ASIO, Australia’s secret service, contacts Harvey with strange news. The body of his father, a documentary filmmaker, missing since Harvey was a boy, has been found in the desert outback, buried inside a thirty year old plane wreck and the wreck is discovered to be radioactive.

results.title: Ground water
results.brief_description: A study of ground water; the following aspects are dealt with in detail: the funtion of water in changing the face of the earth in producing spectacular geological phenomena, and its vital importance to man; artesian systems, springs, wells, water tables, caves; such spectacular phenomena as geysers, roaring springs, hot springs, sink holes, petrification, geode fillings, and the concentration of minerals. Below the surface of the earth, often unknown to man, water works many transformations. Both animation and direct photography of well-known examples of these various phenomena, many of them famous as tourist attractions in USA are presented in this film.

results.title: Ground water
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Groundwater is the accumulation of water which seeps through cracks, fissures and faults into the earth and collects in a large quantity beneath the surface. Many continents have large water tables which are accessed through wells and bores. Groundwater seeping through limestone helps form stalectites and stalecmites in caves. Groundwater contamination presents serious health risks therefore geologists who study the movement of water play an important role in assessing potential risks.
